flawed_nl_solution:
Of her original 25 apples, Sarah gave five to friends, meaning she has no more than 25-5=<<25-5=22>>22 apples available to give to teachers.
She ate one while walking home, meaning she had no more than 22-1=<<22-1=21>>21 apples available to give to teachers.
And since she had three apples remaining when she got home, then the amount she had given to teachers was 21-3=<<21-3=18>>18 apples.
#### 18

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 20, not 22. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
